contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=November 2008}} {{about|confectionery|Dum Dum bullets|Expanding bullet}} [[Image:Dum Dums Lollipops.jpg|thumb|Unwrapped Dum Dums Lollipops]] A '''Dum Dum Pop''' (or '''Dum Dum''') is a sphere-shaped [[lollipop]] named by I.C. Bahr, a Sales Manager at the Akron Candy Company in [[Bellevue, Ohio]], in 1924.<ref>http://www.dumdumpops.com/about-us</ref> In 1953 the Dum Dum Pop was purchased by the [[Spangler Candy Company]]<ref name=mentalfloss>{{cite web|url=http://mentalfloss.com/article/30823/what-mystery-flavor-dum-dums|title=What Is the Mystery Flavor of Dum Dums?|accessdate=13 March 2013}}</ref> and moved manufacturing to [[Bryan, Ohio]].{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}} Dum Dums are made from [[sugar]] and [[corn syrup]] that is cooked before coloring and flavoring are added. After pressing, the stick is then added. ==Flavors== Dum Dums are made in sixteen flavors with new flavors rotating into the mix every so often.<ref name=FlavorHistory>{{cite web|title=Dum Dums Flavor History|url=http://www.dumdumpops.com/flavor-history|work=Dum Dums|publisher=Spangler Candy Company|accessdate=7 July 2013}}</ref> The Mystery Flavor continuously changes and according to Spangler Candy Company, the mystery flavor is not limited to the current Dum Dums flavor mix. # [[Lemon]] (original flavor, 1953–2000) # [[Lime (fruit)|Lime]] (original flavor, 1953–1991) # [[Orange (fruit)|Orange]] (original flavor, 1953–2000, 2011–) # [[Pina colada|Coconut-Pineapple]] (original flavor, 1953–1970, 2005–2008) # [[Cherry]] (original flavor, 1953–) # [[Grape]] (original flavor, 1953–) # [[Butterscotch]] (original flavor, 1953–) # [[Root Beer]] (1953–1961, 1968–) # [[Strawberry]] (1954–) # [[Chocolate]] (1955-1960, 1966–1975, 2002–2008) # [[Banana]] (1960–1966, 2005–2008) # [[Raspberry]] (1961–1968, 1975–1982) # [[Prunus serotina|Black Cherry]] (1968–1970) # [[Cream Soda]] (1968–) # [[Pineapple]] (1970–2001) # [[Watermelon]] (1982–) # [[Peach]] (1987–2002) # [[Sour Apple]] (1991–2000, 2001–) # [[Blue raspberry flavor|Blu Raspberry]] (1995–) # [[Orange (fruit)|Orange]] [[Cream]] (2000–2002) # [[Fruit Punch]] (2001–2002, 2011–) # [[Buttered Popcorn]] (2001) # [[Bubble Gum]] (2002–) # [[Cotton Candy]] (2002–) # [[Cherry Cola]] (2005–2009) # [[Pink Lemonade]] (2005–2009) # Ashlynn [[Coconut]] (2008–2010) # [[Tangerine]] (2008–2011) # [[Mango]] (2008–2013) # [[Banana Split]] (2009–2011) # [[Strawberry Shortcake]] (2009–2011) # Savannah [[Blueberry]] (2010-) # [[Dulce de Leche ]] (2011–2013) # [[Raspberry]] [[Lemonade]] (2013-) # [[Peach]]-[[Mango]] (2013-) # Mystery (2001-) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.dumdumpops.com Dum Dum Pops Official website] [[Category:Brand name confectionery]] [[Category:1924 introductions]] {{Confection-stub}}
